info.title: KubeRay API
info.description: This file contains REST API specification for KubeRay. The file is autogenerated from the swagger definition.

get.summary: Finds all Clusters in all namespaces. Supports pagination, and sorting on certain fields.
Finds all Clusters in a given namespace. Supports pagination, and sorting on certain fields.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace of the clusters to be retrieved.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace of the cluster to be created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required. The cluster to be created.

get.summary: Finds a specific Cluster by ID.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace of the cluster to be retrieved.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The name of the cluster to be retrieved.

delete.summary:
Deletes an cluster without deleting the cluster's runs and jobs. To
avoid unexpected behaviors, delete an cluster's runs and jobs before
deleting the cluster.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the cluster to be deleted.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the cluster to be deleted.

get.summary: Finds all ray services in a given namespace. Supports pagination, and sorting on certain fields.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace of the ray services to be retrieved.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListRayServices call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The number of RayServices to be listed per page. If there are more
RayServices than this number, the response message will contain a
nextPageToken field you can use to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace of the ray service to be created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required. The ray service to be created.

get.summary: Find a specific ray serve by name and namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace used for retrieving the ray service.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The name used for retrieving the ray service.

delete.summary: Deletes a ray service by its name and namespace

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the ray service to be deleted.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the ray service to be deleted.

Update a ray serve.
We may

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required. The ray service to be updated.

patch.summary:
Update a ray serve configs.
Patch mode update without possible deletion the existing raycluster under the hood. 
only support update the service configs and worker.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The namespace of the ray service to be updated.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The name of ray service to be updated.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required. The ray service to be updated.

parameters.name: pageToken

The number of RayServices to be listed per page. If there are more
RayServices than this number, the response message will contain a
nextPageToken field you can use to fetch the next page.

VolumeHostPathType.description:
If indicate hostpath, we need to let user indicate which type 
they would like to use.

name.description: Required input field. Unique cluster name provided by user.

namespace.title: Required input field. Cluster's namespace provided by user

user.description: Required field. This field indicates the user who owns the cluster.

version.title: Optional input field. Ray cluster version

clusterSpec.title: Required field. This field indicates ray cluster configuration

annotations.title: Optional. Annotations, for example, "kubernetes.io/ingress.class" to define Ingress class

envs.description: Optional input field. Container environment variables from user.

createdAt.description: Output. The time that the cluster created.

deletedAt.description: Output. The time that the cluster deleted.

clusterState.title: Output. The status to show the cluster status.state

events.description: Output. The list related to the cluster.

serviceEndpoint.title: Output. The service endpoint of the cluster

name.description: Output. Human readable name for event.

createdAt.description: Output. The creation time of the event.

firstTimestamp.description: Output. The last time the event occur.

lastTimestamp.title: Output. The first time the event occur

reason.description: Output. The reason for the transition into the object's current status.

message.description: Output. A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

type.title: Output. Type of this event (Normal, Warning), new types could be added in the future

count.description: Output. The number of times this event has occurred.

name.title: Name for config map or secret, container name for resource, path for field

key.title: Key for config map or secret, resource name for resource

protoEnvironmentVariables.title: This allows to specify both - environment variables containing values and environment values containing valueFrom

computeTemplate.title: Required. The computeTemplate of head node group

image.title: Optional field. This field will be used to retrieve right ray container

serviceType.title: Optional. The service type (ClusterIP, NodePort, Load balancer) of the head node

enableIngress.title:
Optional. Enable Ingress
if Ingress is enabled, we might have to specify annotation IngressClassAnnotationKey, for the cluster itself, defining Ingress class

rayStartParams.description: Required. The ray start params of head node group.

volumes.title: Optional. The volumes mount to head pod

serviceAccount.title:
Optional. ServiceAccount used by head pod
Note that the service account has to be created prior to usage here

imagePullSecret.title: Optional. image pull secret used by head pod

environment.title: Optional. Environment variables for head pod

annotations.title: Optional. Annotations for the head pod

labels.title: Optional. Labels for the head pod

storageClassName.title: If indicate ephemeral, we need to let user specify volumeClaimTemplate

groupName.title: Required. Group name of the current worker group

computeTemplate.title: Required. The computeTemplate of head node group

image.title: Optional field. This field will be used to retrieve right ray container

replicas.title: Required. Desired replicas of the worker group

minReplicas.description: Optional. Min replicas of the worker group, can't be greater than max_replicas.

maxReplicas.title: Required. Max replicas of the worker group (>0)

rayStartParams.title: Required. The ray start parameters of worker node group

volumes.title: Optional. The volumes mount to worker pods

serviceAccount.title:
Optional. ServiceAccount used by worker pod
Note that the service account has to be created prior to usage here

imagePullSecret.title: Optional. image pull secret used by worker pod

environment.title: Optional. Environment variables for worker pod

annotations.title: Optional. Annotations for the worker pod

labels.title: Optional. Labels for the worker pod

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

name.title: Required. The name of the compute template

namespace.title: Required. The namespace of the compute template

gpuAccelerator.title: Optional. The detail gpu accelerator type

protoComputeTemplate.title: ComputeTemplate can be reused by any compute units like worker group, workspace, image build job, etc

name.title: The ID of the image template

namespace.title: The namespace of the image template

baseImage.title: The base container image to be used for image building

customCommands.title: The post install commands to execute

protoImageTemplate.title:
ImageTemplate can be used by worker group and workspce.
They can be distinguish by different entrypoints

key.title: key created by the node's taint

name.description: Required input field. Unique job name provided by user.

namespace.title: Required input field. job namespace provided by user

user.description: Required field. This field indicates the user who owns the job.

metadata.description: Optional. Metadata is data to store along with this job.

runtimeEnv.title: Optional. RuntimeEnv is a Yaml string which maps to the RuntimeEnvYAML field of the RayJobSpec

jobId.description: Optional. If jobId is not set, a new jobId will be auto-generated.

shutdownAfterJobFinishes.description: Optional. If set to true, the rayCluster will be deleted after the rayJob finishes. Defaults to false.

clusterSelector.description: Optional. The label selectors to choose exiting clusters. If not specified, cluster_spec must be set.

clusterSpec.description: Optional. The cluster template, required if the cluster_selector is not specified.

ttlSecondsAfterFinished.description: Optional. TTLSecondsAfterFinished is the TTL to clean up RayCluster.

entrypointNumCpus.description: Optional entrypointNumCpus specifies the number of cpus to reserve for the entrypoint command.

entrypointNumGpus.description: Optional entrypointNumGpus specifies the number of gpus to reserve for the entrypoint command.

entrypointResources.description:
Optional entrypointResources specifies the custom resources and quantities to reserve for the
entrypoint command.

createdAt.description: Output. The time that the job created.

deleteAt.description: Output. The time that the job deleted.

jobDeploymentStatus.title: Output. The current job deployment status

message.description: Output. A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

image.title:
Required base image for job submitter. Make sure that Python/Ray version
of the image corresponds to the one used in the cluster

cpu.title: Optional number of CPUs for submitter - default "1"

memory.title: Optional memory for the submitter - default "1Gi"

runtimeEnv.description: This deployment's runtime_env used by the actor.

cpusPerActor.description: Required. The number of CPUs required by the deployment's application per replica.

gpusPerActor.description: Required. The number of GPUs required by the deployment's application per replica.

memoryPerActor.description: Required. Restrict the heap memory usage of each replica.

objectStoreMemoryPerActor.description: Restrict the object store memory used per replica when creating objects.

customResource.description: The custom resources required by each replica.

accceleratorType.description: Forces replicas to run on nodes with the specified accelerator type.

protoActorOptions.description: ActorOptions config actor configuration related to one serve deployement.

totalSize.description: The total number of RayServices for the given query.

nextPageToken.description: The token to list the next page of RayServices.

totalSize.description: The total number of RayServices for the given query.

nextPageToken.description: The token to list the next page of RayServices.

name.description: Required input field. Unique ray service name provided by user.

namespace.title: Required input field. ray service namespace provided by user

user.description: Required field. This field indicates the user who owns the ray service.

serveDeploymentGraphSpec.description: The config for ray serve deployments V1.

serveConfigV2.title: Config for serve deployment V2. Note that only one config V1 or V2 can be specified

rayServiceStatus.description: Output. The status for the ray service.

createdAt.description: Output. The time that the ray service created.

deleteAt.description: Output. The time that the ray service deleted.

name.description: Output. Human readable name for event.

createdAt.description: Output. The creation time of the event.

firstTimestamp.description: Output. The last time the event occur.

lastTimestamp.title: Output. The first time the event occur

reason.description: Output. The reason for the transition into the object's current status.

message.description: Output. A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

type.title: Output. Type of this event (Normal, Warning), new types could be added in the future

count.description: Output. The number of times this event has occurred.

applicationStatus.description:
NOTE(zcin): the first three fields are deprecated in favor of serve_application_status.
(Deprecated) The ray serve application status.

applicationMessage.description: (Deprecated) A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

rayServiceEvents.description: The related event for the ray service.

serviceEndpoint.description: The service endpoint of the cluster and service.

serveDeploymentStatus.title: All ray serve deployment statuses in this application

deploymentName.description: Required. Input field. Unique ray service deployment name provided by user.

replicas.description: Rquired. Ray service deployment replicas, default set to 1.

routePrefix.description: ray service deployment route prefix indicated by user.

maxConcurrentQueries.description: max concurrent queries indicate for each ray service deployment.

userConfig.description: user config to the ray serve deployment.

autoscalingConfig.description: auto scaling config for ray serve deployment indicate by user.

actorOptions.description: Required. Actor options indicated resource of each deployment's actor.

importPath.description: Required input field. Import path for load the ray serve.

runtimeEnv.description: runtime env for loading the ray serve.

serveConfigs.description: Required. Deployments config of the ray serve.

message.description: A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

workerGroupUpdateSpec.title: Required. Specify the worker group to be update

serveDeploymentGraphSpec.description: Required. Deployments config of the ray serve.

groupName.description: The name of the worker group to be updated.

replicas.description: Required. The replicas of the worker group to be updated.

minReplicas.description: Required. The min replicas of the worker group to be updated.

maxReplicas.description: Required. The max replicas of the worker group to be updated.
